direction.raw_text: by Lewis Abernathy
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is coming down the sidewalk in slow motion. Her dress and long hair blow slightly in the breeze. The SOUND of CHILDREN CHANTING increases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One... two... Freddy's coming for you. On "you" there is a RUMBLE and a flash -- like quick lightning only evil.  (Choice flashes from Nightmare on Elm Street 1 & 2). Meagan turns at 1665.  A beautiful white, two-story house, thick with lush green foliage.  Several beautiful children, all dressed in bright white, play hopscotch and jumprope on the front walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three... four... better lock your door. Close on a little girl's foot coming down on the number
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drawn on concrete. Another RUMBLE and flash -- longer, LOUDER.  (Flashes from Nightmare 3 & 4). Meagan continues up the walk, the wind is blowing a little harder now.  The trees are brown, the leaves peeling away. Moving up the walk, closer to the house... only now it's a little darker, needs some paint.  On the front porch, a LITTLE GIRL rides a tricycle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five... six...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Flash.  (Nightmare 5 and Freddy's Dead).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...grab your crucifix.. ix.. ix.. The "ix" echoes away, becoming the faint "Ka ka ka" we all recognize as Jason's theme.  Meagan turns to find that the children in the yard have vanished. It's nighttime. The trees are dead, the grass is gone, and the horizon stretches off into utter nothingness.  Meagan turns back to the little girl. But the little girl has gone.  Only the tricycle remains.  It circles once, the front door CREAKS open, and the empty tricycle peddles inside.  Meagan follows it into the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan enters the house slowly, watching as the tri- cycle rides off down a creepy hallway and disappears. Then the front door blows shut behind Meagan.  She tries to open it -- locked. Then faint VOICES cause Meagan to pause.  She listens, trying to make out the low murmur.  Then a little girl's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Meagan recognizes it as her sister's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lizzy? Meagan moves up the stairs, going down the hall... following the voices (we recognize the other voice as belonging to Freddy).  Meagan enters a door at the end of the hallway, moving into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the floor, near her bed, is Meagan's thirteen year old sister -- LIZZY.  Slow for her age, Lizzy sits and draws with crayons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lizzy. What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Playing with my friend. Meagan looks at the drawings -- childlike renderings of Freddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your friend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lives under the bed. Meagan slowly gets to her knees and takes a peek under Lizzy's bed. Suddenly, a doll-sized Freddy scurries out from under the bed, flashing past Meagan's face and running out the door.  Meagan yelps and touches her face -- five tiny slash marks on her cheek.  Lizzy clucks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You scared him... Meagan looks out the door, incredulous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I scared him? But when Meagan looks back, Lizzy is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lizzy? Lizzy echoes away as Meagan finds herself standing in the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tiny Freddy dashes from the pews and jumps into a casket at the altar, slamming the lid shut.  Meagan goes to the casket and carefully opens the lid.  Inside
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a rotting corpse with worms and maggots crawling all over it.  Meagan screams and slams the lid back down. The casket starts to move -- THUMP! THUMP! THUMP! Then it stops.  Tentatively, Meagan opens the lid again. Inside -- FREDDY KRUEGER.  He grabs her arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where ya been all my death, baby? Meagan screams.  Freddy leaps out of the casket in a tuxedo, crooning:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been waitin' at the altar for a long, long time! Meagan looks down -- she's wearing a wedding dress, spattered with blood.  Behind her, the chapel has filled with dozens of DEAD PEOPLE in various stages of decay.  A SATANIC PRIEST appears in the pulpit and asks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are the bridesmaids in attendance? Meagan looks to her left -- four girls hold bouquets, dressed in body bags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the groomsmen...? Freddy opens his tuxedo jacket to reveal several trapped souls struggling to get out of his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If anyone here believes that these two should not be joined in unholy matrimony, let him speak now or forever rot in hell... >From the back of the chapel, a voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan! Meagan turns.  It's her boyfriend -- JESSE.  He stands in the chapel doorway, backlit by bright light, arms outstretched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse! Meagan runs to Jesse and grabs him, their arms encircling one another.  She looks up into Jesse's eyes... only it isn't Jesse. It's Jason. Meagan screams as Jason raises his machete, bringing it down between her eyes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan opens an eye as her alarm clock BUZZES... she was dreaming.  She gets up quickly and crosses to her dresser.  She looks into the mirror, at the tiny cuts on her cheek, and clucks.  Then she exits, going into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan opens the door to her sister's room, breathing a sigh of relief when she sees Lizzy curled up in bed with a doll.  Meagan smiles and starts to exit when she notices something not quite right about the doll. She moves closer and pulls Lizzy's arm away to reveal a hideous little Freddy doll.  Meagan gasps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freddy... Suddenly, the doll opens it's eyes and sneers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well it ain't Raggedy Ann, bitch! The Freddy doll flashes it's tiny glove of knives, thrusting them deep into Meagan's chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (for real) Meagan sits up suddenly in bed, clutching her chest. She looks down and sees that there is nothing there. Meagan sighs and falls back in her bed -- just a bad dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! -- her alarm clock BUZZES.  Meagan sits up with a start again.  Her fright turns to rage as she pounds the alarm clock into submission.  Meagan climbs out of bed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan enters and finds Lizzy still asleep, clutching her Raggedy Ann doll.  She gently pries the doll away, tossing it disdainfully away.  Meagan picks up a small glass unicorn and playfully prances it around on Lizzy's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wake up, sleepy head. Time to wake up. Lizzy's eyes flutter open.  She smiles at her sister, then frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had a bad dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry... they can't hurt you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise. Lizzy hugs Meagan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll never let anyone hurt you.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AM NEWS SPECIAL REPORT -- COPS V

direction.raw_text: ON a small television set on the kitchen table. A flashy graphic flashes across the screen: AM NEWS SPECIAL REPORT -- COPS V.S. THE CULT -- DAY 13.  A NEWS REPORTER stands in front a police blockade. In the background, dozens of POLICE and S.W.A.T. MEN surround a small run-down, two-story house... Freddy's house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the sun rises on yet another morning, still no end in sight for the standoff between police and the mysterious group known only as the "Freddy" cult who seized the abandoned house behind me just thirteen days ago.  These cultists -- mostly run- away teenagers -- have managed to keep police at bay for almost two weeks while inside they take mind- altering narcotics in order to communicate with their god -- Freddy. The reporter babbles on as Meagan enters the kitchen where MEAGAN'S MOM is sitting watching the TV, gulping down orange juice.  Across from mom is MEAGAN'S DAD, who is having coffee, reading the paper.  Meagan pours herself a cup and sits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning. Meagan's mom grunts, transfixed on the news.  Dad looks over his paper long enough to smile and say, just a little too cheerfully:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning, Meagan. Meagan looks over at her mother, then back at her father, mouthing the words "How's mom?", when suddenly Meagan's mom bellows:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lizzy! Get down here! Breakfast is almost ready! Meagan turns back to her dad but he has ducked back into his paper.  Meagan sighs and sips her coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a police booking photo of FRED KRUEGER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alleged child murderer Fred Krueger was released on a legal technicality but later burned to death at the hands of a vigilante mob of grieving parents.  Some years later, a rash of bizarre and unexplainable teen- age deaths began leaving many in the area to wonder... is Freddy really dead? Meagan's younger sister -- LIZZY -- comes down to breakfast.  The microwave DINGS and Meagan's mom pulls out three Pop Tarts, dealing them out to her family like playing cards.  Lizzy picks up her Pop Tart, whining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry up and eat. You don't want to be late for special school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom! Don't call it that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate that school. The other kids are mean... and they're all re- tard-ed! Meagan snickers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't use that word. They're "special" children just like you're "special". Dad looks over at mom, who shoots him an angry look. Dad takes a bite of his Pop Tart, sinking back behind the paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cult members have declined to an on-camera interview but did send out a note with a message. The note
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: which, by the way, appears to have been written in blood -- reads... (reads the note) To the parents of Springwood -- Freddy lives! Soon he will come and take one of your children as his virgin bride. Then Freddy will -BEEP- and his -BEEP- upon her -BEEP- and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and behold, a soulless child shall be born. The vessel for Freddy to rise and rule the darkness forever and ever. A horn TOOTS outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Jesse. Let's go, Lizzy. Meagan collects her books and her sister. This is dad's cue to look at his watch and say:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, look at the time! I've got to be going... anyone need me to bring anything home tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need an alarm clock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with your old one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Broke. Meagan kisses her dad as she and Lizzy hurry out the door.  Meagan's dad looks over at his wife, who says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're almost out of vodka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MORNING - CONTINUOUS ACTION Meagan and Lizzy climb into JESSE's car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning! Hey, what's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mom...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had another dream last night...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was I naked?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. You were Jason.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason? Oh, yeech... (then) Was I any good? Meagan playfully smacks him as Jesse's car ROARS off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan's dad hesitates at the front door, clutching his keys and briefcase as he musters the courage to say something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have to watch that crap all the time? Months and months of the O.J. Simpson trial, and now this... Mom reaches over and switches off the TV. Dad smiles slightly and exits. Mom waits until the door closes, then takes a bottle of vodka and pours a goodly bit into her orange juice.  She takes a deep drink and switches the set back on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the news reporter interviews CAPTAIN RENTON MURDOCH -- State Trooper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm standing here with State Trooper Captain Renton Murdoch, the man the Governor has called in to deal with the cultists because of his past experience with occult-style murderers. In fact, Trooper Murdoch is the only law enforcement officer ever to survive a one-on-one encounter with notorious Camp Crystal Lake killer -- Jason Voorhees. (to Murdoch) You received some pretty nasty injuries in your battle with Jason, didn't you, Captain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing serious... just a few stitches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about these so called "Freddy" cultists? They seem like pretty tough customers. Think you'll have any trouble getting them out of there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Now that the Governor has given me complete authority to deal with these punks I should be putting an end to their situation pretty quick. Unless of course their attorney is able to get them to come out peace- fully... but I don't hold out much hope for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Renton Murdoch, ladies and gentlemen. A tough cop... for tough criminals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murdoch gets into the command car, sitting down next to the S.W.A.T. COMMANDER sitting behind the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn media... oughtta be a law. (gestures to house) Is that shyster still in there trying to talk them out? S.W.A.T. COMMANDER Yeah... he's making them some kind of deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn lawyers... what a bunch of assholes. Shakespeare was right -- kill all the lawyers. Then we could kill all the punks with no hassles and the world would be a safer place. S.W.A.T. COMMANDER Smaller anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhhhh... what did Shakespeare know? Long-haired, English freak. He was probably a punk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meanwhile, inside the house... the cult's sleazy LAWYER is sitting on a crate in the middle of a dark room. He is surrounded by CULTISTS -- heavily-armed teenage punks in red and olive sweaters and Fedoras ala Freddy. They stare out at him through sunglasses with red flashing diodes that barely hide their burned and disfigured faces. The lawyer shifts uncomfortably on the crate as he takes a deep snort from inside his briefcase held neatly on his lap.  Then he lifts his head, wiping his nose nervously as he speaks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, as I explained to you before, the revenues between the TV movie deal and the book sale should be adequate to fund your joint-defense. And I think with my mass media hypnosis argument I could get each of you a reduced sentence on appeal
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: say... twenty years each. Out in fifteen with good behavior? Hmmmmm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lawyer's disembodied head comes sailing out of an upstairs window, smacking into the command car's windshield with a loud SPLAT! S.W.A.T. COMMANDER Jesus Christ! Murdoch curses and leaps out of the car, charging the house as he BLASTS away with two nickel-plated .45s.  Suddenly GUNFIRE erupts from every window in the house, BULLET HITS RIDDLING the cops cars,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: windows and emergency lights. The S.W.A.T. TEAM follows Murdoch through the hail of GUNFIRE as he kicks open the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! -- the door flies open and Murdoch and the S.W.A.T. team move in.  The windows have been covered with foil, the walls have been painted black with cult slogans written in red, making the whole house black as pitch.  The S.W.A.T. team puts on their night vision goggles and starts moving through the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THROUGH NIGHT VISION GOGGLES as the S.W.A.T. team goes through the house SHOOTING cultists (ala the computer game DOOM).  Then a blinding flash of light and a S.W.A.T. guy goes down -- shot in the face. Several of the cultists lead the attacking S.W.A.T. team deeper into the house.  As one of the S.W.A.T. guys follows his foot trips a wire.  A trap door opens in the floor and the S.W.A.T. guy falls into a pit, waist deep in water.  Suddenly, the water starts churning and the guy starts screaming -- it's a tank of piranhas!  Two other S.W.A.T. guys grab his arms and pull him out.  Too late -- his legs have been shredded to the bone. Another S.W.A.T. guy kicks in a door to a room and steps in, FIRING his machine gun.  A large scythe swings down and severs both his arms at the elbows. His arms fall to the floor, still FIRING the machine gun. The cultists race into a room, grabbing handrailing bolted over head.  They swing like monkeys across the ceiling just as a S.W.A.T. guy charges into the room behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON S.W.A.T. GUY'S BOOTS as he steps onto a floor covered with upturned nails.  Several nails puncture both boots, the points coming up through the laces. The S.W.A.T. guy screams and another S.W.A.T. guy barrels into the room to see what is wrong.  He knocks the first guy face-first into the floor o' nails. Meanwhile, Murdoch is having a blast -- literally. He kicks open the door to a room and guns down three cultists as they try to escape out a window.  As the last body pitches to the floor, Murdoch yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freeze! Murdoch exits, laughing to himself. The running GUNBATTLE continues as the cultists retreat to the back of the house, throwing molotov cocktails.  Soon the first floor is ablaze. A S.W.A.T. guy screams as he is consumed by FIRE.  The cultists thunder down a back staircase to the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cultists uncover a secret passageway under the house and most escape through the underground tunnel just before the S.W.A.T. team comes BLASTING into the basement.  As the last of the remaining cultists is capped off, a faint voice cries for help.  The S.W.A.T. commander raises up his hand. S.W.A.T. COMMANDER Hold your fire! He pulls off his night vision goggles and shines his flashlight into the basement.  Through the dense smoke he sees a little girl in a white dress is tied to a chair sitting on a crate.  Underneath the chair
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: several sticks of dynamite wired to a timer. CLOSE ON THE TIMER: 30... 29... 28...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me, mister... please. The S.W.A.T. commander rushes to the girl, kneeling down to look at the bomb.  Then he takes a Leatherman tool from his vest and starts to work on the bomb's timer. S.W.A.T. COMMANDER Hang on, honey... I'll have you out of there in a second. Murdoch comes down the stairs.  He goes to the secret passageway and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like we'll have to hunt the rest of them down. Let's go before they get too far. S.W.A.T. COMMANDER We can't leave! Can't you see we've got a situation here? Murdoch looks at the little girl and shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave her. S.W.A.T. COMMANDER You're crazy! I can't just leave her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it. I've seen this before. There's nothing you can do. S.W.A.T. COMMANDER I've got to try... The S.W.A.T. commander wipes his brow and leans in to work on the bomb again.  CLOSE ON TIMER: 24...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... 22... The basement ceiling is now fully ABLAZE and chunks of BURNING DEBRIS fall around the skittish S.W.A.T. team.  Murdoch looks at his watch in a bored fashion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're wasting your time. The S.W.A.T. commander studies the wires for another second, then glances back at the timer... 15... 14...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... S.W.A.T. COMMANDER Fuck it! The S.W.A.T. commander whips out his Spyderco knife and cuts the little girl loose.  He carries her out in his arms as he shouts to his men: S.W.A.T. COMMANDER (continuing; yelling)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! SHE'S GOIN' BLOW!!! The S.W.A.T. team exits the basement with Murdoch bringing up the rear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The S.W.A.T. commander staggers out with the little girl, followed closely with the remainder of his men and finally Murdoch.  The commander throws himself to the ground, covering the little girl with his body as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! -- the Elm Street house EXPLODES! Murdoch stands as debris rains down around him.  He mutters:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Punks. As the dust settles, the S.W.A.T. commander rolls off the little girl and starts checking her for injury. S.W.A.T. COMMANDER Are you okay, honey? Suddenly, the little girl jumps onto the S.W.A.T. commander, flashing a glove of knives.  She hisses:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freddy lives! With a quick swing, the little girl slashes the commander's face.  She dives back for a plunge to his throat when Murdoch walks up and kicks her off. He puts his boot on her, holding her down as he takes aim on her head with his pistol -- execution style. S.W.A.T. COMMANDER NO! The S.W.A.T. commander grabs Murdoch's arm just in time.  Several cops rush in and grab the girl, dragging her off, kicking and screaming. S.W.A.T. COMMANDER (continuing) Jesus... you were going to kill that kid, weren't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you you were wasting your time. Once these kids go rabid, best thing to do is put 'em down. S.W.A.T. COMMANDER You can't be serious...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead serious. See... the world is made up of rules. Kids don't like rules. They rebel for a while, but ultimately they start to fall in line and become ordinary Joe's like you and me. But some kids... dope smokers mainly, watching their MTV... Satanic lyrics melting what's left of their brains... these kids grow up to be punks. And when these punks step as far over the line as these "Freddy" punks have -- then we as peace officers have no choice but to kill them. S.W.A.T. COMMANDER I didn't become a peace officer to kill kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Punks. There's a difference... (under his breath) ...barely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: written across lockers -- FREDDY LIVES! We move from this to a small classroom window. Through it we see Meagan sitting in economics class.  The instructor -- MISS KREPPS -- is lecturing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Blah-blah. Blah-blah-blah.) It's hot.  Several of the kids fan themselves, struggling to stay awake while others have already passed out on their desks.  Meagan's eyes are heavy. She looks over at Jesse, pretending to follow along in his book, fast asleep.  The antique oscillating fan on Miss Krepps' desk CLICKS loudly as she drones on:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Blah-blah-blah. Blah-blah.) Meagan starts to drift off, when...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I asked if you were ready to give your oral report?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... I'm ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please come up here to the podium. Meagan gets up and goes to the podium amidst the snickers of some of her classmates.  Miss Krepps snaps her fingers for quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't think it's funny when you haven't learned the fundamentals of a free market economy... oh, why do I waste my breath? You're all going to grow up to be gas station attendants and waitresses anyway. Go ahead, Meagan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My report is on Global Economic Trends. (clears throat; begins reading) Try and think of a world where there is no poverty... no sickness... no crime. A world where everyone is happy to be alive and everyone lives together in peace. This is my dream. The fan on Miss Krepps' desk starts to CLICK louder,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: harder.  Meagan raises an eyebrow but continues with her report.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This dream is becoming a reality with ever-growing international business...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as it changes... getting creepier... turning into a Freddy-fan.  BLOWING harder... CLICKING louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louder, Meagan. We can't hear you. Meagan repeats the last few sentences, raising her voice to be heard over the fan.  Then pages of her report start to blow away.  She grabs at them as the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: increases. A bottle of glue stowed in the podium overturns and spills to the floor at Meagan's feet.  She bends over to pick it up, when her skirt blows up.  She presses it down but the WIND is too great and the skirt billows up, revealing her underwear.  The class roars with laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louder, Meagan... we still can't hear you. But Meagan isn't reading her report anymore, she's busy trying to push down her skirt when -- RIP! -- the WIND blows her skirt off.  Her classmates fall over themselves, laughing.  RIP! -- Meagan's blouse blows away.  She tries to hide behind the podium when that too is swept off. Meagan clutches at her bra and panties as they start to drift away -- thread by thread.  She is almost naked.  Meagan looks up at her classmates, red in the face. Her classmates point and laugh -- only now they are all a bunch of old rotten skeletons.  And up front, in the center where Miss Krepps sat... is Freddy! He wears a beanie with a propeller, points and laughs:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aww... all dressed up and nowhere to blow! Meagan screams, clutching at the last few tiny strands of cloth that cover her body.  She calls to Jesse, pleading:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse... please, help me. But Jesse just sits at his desk -- dead.  He reaches up and slowly lowers a hockey mask over his pale, expressionless face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like a photo opportunity to me! Freddy pulls out an over-sized camera with a gargantuan flashgun attached.  The flash bulb is the size of a beach ball and has a nuclear warning etched in the front.  Freddy sizes Meagan up in the viewfinder and sneers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say... cheesecake!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! -- the flash bulb goes off with an atomic light.  Meagan screams as her skeleton is blown back against the blackboard -- vaporized!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan waking up in her seat suddenly.  The classroom as normal.  Miss Krepps is standing over her, asking:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan? Meagan?! Meagan looks around, bewildered and confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I asked if you were ready to give your report? Meagan realizes that she was dreaming and pulls herself together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure... Meagan stands up and faints.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .O.V as the SCHOOL NURSE comes into FOCUS, standing over her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan? Can you hear me? Do you know where you are? Meagan is laying on a couch, a cloth over her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was day dreaming and then I woke up but then it was like I was still dreaming and then I woke up and then I guess I fainted and now I'm awake again...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure? Meagan stares at the nurse for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm waiting to see if you're going to turn into Freddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freddy... I see. You've been watching too much CNN. That crazy "Freddy" cult thing -- it's all over the TV day and night -- you can't get away from it. No wonder you kids are all having nightmares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But this one was different... it felt real.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that's just it, Meagan... dreams aren't real. They're just broken fragments of the subconscious mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fear is real though, isn't it? And if nightmares are fear, then doesn't that make them real?! (gets excited) And if the nightmares are real then is reality like a dream?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan! You've got heat prostration... that's all. The nurse slaps a wet towel over her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse is waiting for Meagan as she emerges from the nurse's office, muttering under her breath:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old witch... what does she know? She isn't even qualified to give a shot and she's telling me that my dreams aren't anything to worry about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So she said you were okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, sure... Madame Curie in there says it's just a case of heat pro- stration and an overdose of TV news. Ruined my makeup, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you're going back to class?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. She gave me last period off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what are you bitching about? I could have a compound fracture of the skull and she wouldn't excuse me from P.E.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse! I've been having nightmares for almost two weeks now and they keep getting worse! Now I'm having daymares! I want to know why!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... well, didn't the nurse say it was heat probation? Meagan rolls her eyes in frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't understand... I want to know more about dreams. What they mean... why we have them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Meg, go look it up. You've got the rest of the day off, that's all I'm saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a good idea. Why don't you cut last period and come with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Where are we going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The library.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to cut school so we can go to the library?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan pours through a big psychology book.  Across the table, Jesse peers into another psychology book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find anything? Jesse looks up suddenly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Oh, no... nothing yet. Over Jesse's shoulder we see he has a copy of ROAD &
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tucked inside his psychology book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know that our sub-conscious retains everything that ever happened to us? Everything. From the time we're born until we die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how Freddy gets at us... by using our sub-conscious fears. Fears our conscious minds have repressed or forgotten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got a news flash for you... Freddy's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not so sure... if Freddy exists in our sub-conscious then he can never be fully erased. Like a bad memory... you may blot it out of your mind but it will alway be hiding someplace in your dreams. (off Jesse's disbelieving stare) Weren't you scared as a child by something so stupid that you're ashamed to admit it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what? What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... when I was kid, my brother took me to the carnival. And in the penny arcade there was this robot gunslinger...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Black Bart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know about Black Bart?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duh. You put your quarter in and he says, "Go ahead and draw, tenderfoot." And then you pull your gun out and shoot him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's just it -- I never could! I'd point the gun right at him and shoot, and I could never hit the guy. So I always got killed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one can hit him -- it's a gyp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scared the shit out of me. Meagan tries to hide her smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't that scary? I mean... for a kid? Meagan laughs.  Somebody shushes her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, smartass... what about you? What scared you the most as a kid? A dark mood falls over Meagan as her mind winds back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember... Lizzy wandered off one day and we couldn't find her. The police came and everything. I wasn't really worried until I saw her picture on TV... then I got really scared. (then) Jesse, I can't explain it... but I think something bad's going to happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lizzy sits on the steps of her school, clutching her books and Raggedy Ann doll... waiting. Behind her, wearing a protective helmet, another learning disabled kid - LEONARD - taunts her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're stupid!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you are!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They forgot you again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, they didn't!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, they forgot and you're goin' to wait out here until it's dark and then the monsters are goin' come and get you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No they won't, because I'm walkin' home! Lizzy gets to her feet and starts walking.  Leonard calls after her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come back, Lizzy! You can wait with me! I got forgot too, you know! Lizzy keeps going, marching across the deserted school yard.  Leonard turns to go inside the school when he bumps into a passing CULTIST.  The cultist pushes him down as he follows after Lizzy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... I'm going to have to report this! Lizzy walks briskly along when she gets the feeling she's being followed.  She turns and sees a cultist standing behind a tree several dozen yards behind her. Lizzy turns away and quickens her pace but when she glances back, the figure is still standing... but closer. Scared, Lizzy turns and runs, dropping her books as she flees down the sidewalk.  As she comes to the street, a big black hearse suddenly pulls up in front of her, the door swinging open wide.  Burned arms reach out to grab Lizzy.  She screams. The cultists grab Lizzy, pulling her into the car as it roars off down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: laying in the gutter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse's car pulls up to a sea of police cars parked in front of Meagan's house.  Meagan gets out of the car and rushes inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are everywhere as Meagan bursts into the house, calling for her family.  Jesse enters behind her when Meagan's dad comes up, asking:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't you get my message?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What message?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I called the school after lunch... I had to stay late after work... I... Meagan's mother bellows from the living room where she is talking to a policeman taking notes.  She is drunk and has been crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you dare blame this on her, you sorry bastard! It's all your fault! (to Meagan) Where have you been anyway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The library.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A likely Goddamn story! Meagan's mom breaks down sobbing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad... what's wrong? What's happened? Where's Lizzy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She didn't come home from school today. The police got a report that a girl fitting Lizzy's description was forced into a car by some crazies. They're pretty sure it was this "Freddy" cult.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God... Meagan's dad puts his arm around Meagan and tries to comfort her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now don't worry. The police are doing everything they can. Meagan looks over and sees Murdoch talking to his men when a voice from upstairs calls down:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Cap'n... better have a look up here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Murdoch enters, he spots Lizzy's night table and the small glass menagerie there.  Murdoch picks up the unicorn and admires it when a TROOPER draws his attention to the floor next to the bed. Laying there are several childlike drawings of Freddy, including one that has "Freddy Lives" scrawled across the top. Meagan enters and sees the drawings.  She gasps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like she was in the cult all along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... no, she wouldn't do that! Lizzy wouldn't join Freddy's cult!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it's hard to believe, miss. But a lot of good kids get caught up in this kind of trouble. Murdoch stares at the drawings, his jaw muscles tightening.  He clenches his fist, pulverizing the little unicorn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Punks... Murdoch drops the broken pieces of the unicorn on the table as he exits the room, brushing past Meagan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan's dad follows Murdoch to the door, asking:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Murdoch... is there any- thing we can do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can pray, sir. Pray we find your daughter before... well, before it's too late. But rest assured, if I can't persuade her to come back to her loving home, then I'll do what's best for her. I know you and your wife wouldn't want her to suffer. (to his men) Come on... I want to go talk to Erwin. Murdoch and his men say "good-bye" and quickly exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the last of the cops drive away, Meagan pulls Jesse out of the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over to Stormie's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stormie? I thought you and her weren't friends anymore since she stole that twenty dollars from you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was her "klepto" phase... when she was dating that gang member. She dumped him a long time ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still don't understand. What has she got to do with Lizzy missing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She used to be in the Freddy cult. Maybe she knows where they took Lizzy. They exit to Jesse's car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan's high-strung best friend -- STORMIE -- is blurting out at a mile-a-minute:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I did know I would call the police, you know that. I love Lizzy. No telling what those freaks will do to her. Those Freddy cult guys are hard core.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you were in the cult?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was in the cult for a week cause my boyfriend at the time... Slasher, he was. But I just liked the music and the clothes... when they were clean, but not like the violence and stuff. But that was just my "cult" phase... but I got past that. You know, just like my "gang" phase when I was dating Ramon and then before that was my "death rock" phase when I was dating Stuart...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, excuse me... but what phase are we in now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Militant feminist, man-hating phase, what's it fuckin' to ya?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you just let the cops find her? That guy Renton Murdoch -- he knows how to deal with these cultist psychos. He was the man who got Jason Voorhees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That guy in my dreams...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason kicked his ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse narrates a short, fuzzy, silent flashback as younger-looking Renton Murdoch is BLASTING away at Jason in panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... yeah. But Murdoch put thirteen bullets in Jason before he hacked his head open. Jason cleaves Murdoch's head with a machete.  Murdoch staggers back, raising his pistol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But even with his head hacked open and his brains leaking out, Murdoch still managed to put his last bullet in Jason's eye. Murdoch FIRES, the bullet SMACKING Jason in the eye. Thick blood runs down the hockey mask as Murdoch's body hits the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murdoch lays in a bed, his head covered in bandages. Tubes and hoses running everywhere to all sorts of medical contraptions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, one of my mom's boyfriends worked at the hospital where they took him. He said that Murdoch lost more than half his brain and what little that was left was all twisted up inside. And they had to replace his skull with a metal plate to keep that from leaking out. In a series of quick cuts we move in close on Murdoch's eyes -- dark and menacing -- staring out at us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say he hasn't been the same since.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's different about him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One thing... he used to be a Democrat. Now he votes straight Republican.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think he thinks Lizzy joined the cult or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God... he'll kill her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got to find Lizzy myself. I've got to find her and save her from Freddy before that crazy cop kills her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just where are you going to look? I mean, these cult guys could be holding her anywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murdoch said something about going to talk to somebody named Erwin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Erwin Kelper! He used to be in the Freddy cult! I bet he knows where they took Lizzy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not Squirmin' Erwin -- that freak that used to eat bugs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who else? (to Meagan; bright) Erwin is scary smart -- always brought home "A"s -- but he was kinda fucked up, too... I mean, who isn't really? Anyway, he quit the cult a few months back and the cops put him away for his own safety. They say Freddy's put a death hex on Erwin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A death hex?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, a death hex. You know... where someone wants you dead!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse, Meagan, and Stormie pull past the large sign and into the parking lot.  As Jesse puts the car in park, Meagan turns to him and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to stay here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be mad... it's just that you might scare him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scare him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What she's subtly trying to tell you is that this needs a woman's gentle touch... butthead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just stay here... okay? Jesse grudgingly agrees.  Meagan kisses Jesse on the cheek.  Stormie sticks her tongue out at him, then turns as she and Meagan walk toward the main entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CRIES of the insane echo through the building as the SECURITY GUARD escorts Meagan and Stormie down a row of cell doors.  He stops at one, tapping lightly on the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo, Erwin... you've got a couple of visitors. Now be a good boy... (to Meagan & Stormie) You've got five minutes. I'll be right down the hall if you need me. The guard exits.  Meagan and Stormie peer through the thick window -- Erwin's padded cell appears vacant. They exchange anxious looks, then Meagan presses a little closer to the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Erwin...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! -- ERWIN suddenly presses his horribly burned face to the glass as he screams:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! YOUR ARMS! Meagan and Stormie jump back, startled.  Then they quickly bare their arms, turning them over for Erwin's inspection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do you shoot?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shoot?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's talking about dream dope -- the stuff the cultists shoot up with so they can talk to Freddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't do drugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not in the cult?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't Freddy send you to kill me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't trust you... better take off your clothes so I can check you for tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chill, Erwin. We're here for some hard data -- not a floppy disk. Erwin flops the arms of his straight jacket, gesturing to the inside of his cell -- empty except for a small mattress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what do you want? Can't you see I'm busy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freddy's cult kidnapped my sister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told her you might know where they took her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I already told the cops everything I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me... please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look... I'm sorry about your sister, but I've got my own problems with Freddy. I'm a marked man, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then tell me why they took her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To bear his child. Freddy wants to be human again. In order to do that he has to be "reborn".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can he do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has to marry a virgin on holy ground. Then the cult consumate the marriage by impregnating her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The whole cult? Yeech!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freddy's the son of a hundred maniacs. It's sort of a tradition with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So the cult gets Lizzy pregnant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Freddy enters the soul of the fetus through a dream state. Voila! Rebirth. There is a moment as the girls take this in, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the stupidest shit I ever heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, they're not my rules... some- body else wrote 'em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Erwin... you've got to help me find Lizzy. You're my only hope. Erwin thinks about this for a second, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll help you find your sister, but you've got to help me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything. Just name it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to help me kill Freddy. Meagan and Stormie exchange looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Freddy's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freddy lives... (looks at Meagan) If only in our dreams. Stormie grabs Meagan by the arm and starts to pull her away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Meagan... our five minutes is up. He's giving me the creeps. But Meagan stays put and asks Erwin:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you kill a dream?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When it's not a dream. (then) Do we have a deal? Erwin presses his palm against the glass.  Meagan thinks a moment, then puts her hand against the glass over his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: AFTERNOON - A SHORT TIME LATER Meagan, Jesse, and Stormie are standing in front of a pay phone, arguing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! I won't do it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Jesse! Please...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's illegal! I could go to jail!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How will they ever know? Don't be such a pussy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah? Why don't you call then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, I will!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! They'll never believe her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can disguise my voice... (lowers voice) Hello, how do you do? My name is Jesse. I think I'm a man but I'm actually a wimp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll never believe that. Come on, Jesse... for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... okay... I'll do it. (to Stormie) And I'm not a wimp! Jesse sighs and steps into the phone booth.  After a moment's hesitation, Jesse steps out and immediately both girls blurt out ten reasons why he should make the call.  Jesse calls for quiet and as soon as both girls shut up, he says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need a quarter for the phone. Meagan fishes out a quarter and hands it to him.  Jesse re-enters the booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Jesse dials a number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The security guard picks up his phone as it RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Springwood Mental Center... how can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a bomb planted in your building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I were you -- I'd get my ass out of there. In the background, we hear Meagan and Stormie whisper something to Jesse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah... Freddy Lives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! -- The guard's eyes grow wide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The peaceful quiet of the asylum is shattered by a fire ALARM.  Soon all the INMATES start filing out into the yard, loosely herded by the GUARDS.  Erwin files out with the others, still wearing his straight jacket. Erwin looks over at the parking lot -- Jesse's car flashes it's lights.  Erwin starts to casually wander off towards the fence between himself and freedom when the SECURITY GUARD spots him and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Erwin... where do you think you're going? Erwin ignores him, still moving towards the fence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm talking to you, asshole! Erwin breaks into a run.  The guard takes off after him. In the car, Jesse, Meagan, and Stormie watch as the guard closes the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not going to make it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got to do something! With grim determination, Jesse starts his car. Jesse's car tears out of the parking lot, racing for the fence.  With a loud, metallic CHING, Jesse's car drives into the fence, knocking that section down. Erwin dances over the downed chain-link, diving into an open window.  Then, with a SQUEAL of tires and the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of metal, Jesse's car backs out of the fence, does a 180, and PEELS off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: INSIDE CAR as Stormie and Meagan help Erwin out of his straight jacket.  Once freed, Erwin extends his hand to Jesse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, my name's Erwin. Thanks for busting me out of there! Jesse looks at Erwin's outstretched hand -- the fingertips are all heavily bandaged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, right... Look, Erwin, just do me one favor -- don't eat nothing disgusting. My stomach is tight enough as it is. The security guard runs up to the fence, huffing and puffing, watching as Jesse's car disappears down the street.  Then he spots something in the fence and plucks it out... Jesse's front license plate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: screaming and crying as the cultists close in around her.  They rip her sleeve off and inject her with a syringe.  After a moment, Lizzy starts to settle down... falling asleep... The cultists lift Lizzy up over their heads and carry her towards the big boiler.  Inside -- a raging INFERNO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- as the cultists reach the boiler, it splits open in the middle like a giant gate.  The two halves swing open wide to reveal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - CONTINUOUS ACTION A narrow rocky ledge extends out to a mausoleum atop a tall, narrow mountain.  On either side of the ledge is a sheer drop to the bleak landscape below -- rivers of hot molten lava stretching out for miles, filled with LOST SOULS DROWNING and BURNING.  Hundreds upon hundreds of voices are SCREAMING and MOANING -- a terrible chorus of the damned. The cultists carry Lizzy across the rocky ledge to the mausoleum.  The outside of this ancient structure is engraved with weird murals depicting the evils of mankind.  In the center -- a large iron gate that swings open as the cultists near. The cultists roll Lizzy over in their arms, holding her tight as they push her face forward into the mirror.  The glass gives way like mercury, Lizzy's face disappearing into the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- Lizzy's face stares out into utter blackness.  Then, some- thing large and evil looking swims up out of the darkness.  Clawed hands reach out and grab Lizzy by the sides of the face as the huge, monstrous head moves forward -- evil lips parting -- tongue slithering out. The evil thing gives Lizzy a big, wet French kiss, locking it's lips over hers.  Several slippery some- things slither into her mouth.  Lizzy struggles, but the big evil thing is way too strong.  Finally, it releases her and the cultists pull her back out. The cultists carry Lizzy out of Hell and back into the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Horribly burned hands slap Lizzy back from her semi- conscious state.  Her eyes grow wide with fear again as she opens her mouth to scream.  Suddenly, she doubles over and vomits up into a tupperware a cultist thrusts under her. Three evil-looking eels slither forth from Lizzy's mouth -- the Dream Demons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Several shadows flee into the night as Jesse's car pulls up next to a run-down building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Erwin leads Meagan, Jesse and Stormie down into the old, burnt out boiler room.  They work their way towards the back, to a large table and a collection of sofas and easy chair scattered about.  Erwin starts sniffing around, pointing out several used syringes laying scattered about the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn! We must have just missed them! Meagan spots Lizzy's shirt sleeve on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God -- she was here! This is part of Lizzy's shirt! It's all torn! (grabs Erwin) Erwin... we've got to find her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're too late! There's no way... except...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Except what?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could go after Freddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How? Erwin goes to a boiler, bends down and reaches way up underneath.  After fishing around for a moment, he draws out a well-worn Mutant Ninja Turtles lunch box.  Inside -- a vile of liquid, several syringes, and several pairs of cult shades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll inject ourselves with Dream Dope.  It's a mild narcotic that brings on a dreamlike state. Meagan thinks about this for a moment, then nods her approval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... let's do it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan... we don't do drugs! I mean, what if one of us gets hooked or something? (whispers) We could turn out like him! Jesse jerks a thumb toward Erwin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about it. We need you wide awake anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going to go under and try to find Freddy. When we do, we'll grab him and bring him here. Then you kill him with this... Erwin hands Jesse an old rusty revolver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This rusty chunk of shit? What good is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not the gun, it's what's in it -- silver bullets blessed by a priest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will that work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should. But then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't make the rules... yeah, yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What should we do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have a seat over there and make yourselves comfortable. Roll up your sleeves and put these on... Erwin hands Meagan and Stormie each a pair of the sunglasses with flashing red diodes in each lens. Stormie puts hers on immediately and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, cool!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are they for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's how the cult keeps in constant contact with Freddy. The little lights flashing are a sustained occular input that causes your brain to resonate at approximately the same frequency at which the dream state is most likely to occur. All of this went over Meagan's head.  Stormie shrugs:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever... (to Meagan; excited) Put 'em on -- they're really cool! Meagan and Stormie sit down in easy chairs, rolling up their sleeves.  Erwin comes over and reclines the chairs, giving each girl an injection.  Then Erwin takes a seat next to Meagan and injects himself.  He lets the syringe drop to the floor as he lowers his glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It helps to hold hands if you want to go together... Meagan clasps hands with Erwin and Stormie.  Jesse watches with skepticism and concern.  Erwin ushers a final warning:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And remember... Freddy knows what scares you. Then all three FALL THROUGH their chairs into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan, Stormie, and Erwin falling through dreamspace (fantastic digital effect tunnel), still holding hands. The girls scream as Erwin smiles and yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse watches over Meagan, Stormie, and Erwin -- all asleep in their chairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan, Stormie, and Erwin fall into a crazy night- mare boiler room (visually reminiscent of the Freddy pictures) with rusty catwalks, huge out-of-proportion fixtures above and a sea of boiling water below.  As they get to their feet, Meagan hears Lizzy's voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan... help me... please... Meagan enters a shaft, following the sound when suddenly, the shaft closes up behind her.  Stormie and Erwin try to find the opening again but can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freddy's trying to split us up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse is standing in front of an old, full length mirror, practicing drawing the pistol.  He pulls it and pretends to fire, blowing imaginary smoke from the muzzle as he says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Freddy... there's a new sheriff in Dreamland now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stormie and Erwin make their way through the creepy boiler room, calling for Meagan.  A strange shadow stalks them -- it's Freddy.  He drops down in front of Erwin and Stormie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking for some-body? Freddy opens up his shirt to reveal a chest full of lost souls.  In the center -- Meagan.  Stormie charges Freddy, throwing her arms around him as she screams to Erwin:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got him! Wake us up! Wake us up! But Erwin is paralyzed with fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't just stand there! Wake us up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmmmm... I feel like seafood tonight. Suddenly, Stormie's arms have become huge lobster claws.  She jerks away from Freddy, but too late -- Stormie starts to change into a giant lobster-woman! Freddy smiles -- now he's wearing a chef's hat and apron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stew on this, bitch! Freddy knocks the lobster-woman over the side.  She falls into the boiling water far below -- KER-SPLASH!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stormie wakes with a start, yelling:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shoot him! Shoot him! Jesse spins, aiming the pistol.  But nothing is there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freddy turns toward Erwin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, well, well... if it isn't my ol' pal, Erwin. Erwin stares wide-eyed, frozen to the spot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got something special in mind for you... Suddenly, Erwin reaches into his sleeve and pulls out a pin.  Freddy gawks -- surprised.  Erwin pricks his finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Erwin wakes with a start.  Stormie smacks him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't help me, you pussy! I could've had him! (smacks him some more) You gutless... spinless... jelly fish! Jesse looks over to where Meagan is still sleeping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan comes down the sidewalk, still following Lizzy's voice...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan... help me... Meagan... It leads her to her house.  Meagan enters the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan sees her father is sitting at the kitchen table, reading his paper.  The headline reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy? He looks up and quietly shushes her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shuuuuu! I'm trying to be invisible... And with that, Meagan's dad disappears.  Only the newspaper remains.  Then Meagan hears Lizzy's VOICE again... upstairs. As she comes down the upstairs hallway, Meagan passes her mother's room.  The door is open a crack.  Meagan looks in and sees her mother putting an empty bottle to her lips.  The bottle sucks the life out of Meagan's mom, who shrivels up into an ugly ol' prune face. Meagan starts to help her mother when Lizzy's cry for help draws her to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan enters.  She sees Lizzy on her bed, under the covers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me... Meagan pulls back the covers to reveal that Lizzy is pregnant, her naked, swollen stomach protruding from her night gown.  Something inside is trying to push it's way out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan... Lizzy screams.  Meagan moves to help her sister when Freddy's glove BURSTS OUT of Lizzy's stomach, stabbing Meagan in the chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan wakes up suddenly.  She looks up at Stormie, Erwin, and Jesse standing over her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay? They help Meagan to her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He got away... I had him and he got away. Oh, God... Lizzy... I lost her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, atleast you're not dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... I'm not dead... (realizes) No... I'm not. But Freddy killed me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He killed me, too. But look... Stormie raises her shirt up to show Meagan she is unharmed.  Erwin sneaks a look and Stormie smacks him. Meagan gets to her feet, asking:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now that I think about it -- he's killed me in all my nightmares. But I'm not dead... what does it mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It means we've still got some time left. Until his remains are host to the Dream Demons -- Freddy can't hurt us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. The Dream Demons...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freddy made a pact with Satan when he died... so Satan bestowed upon him the Dream Demons. They're the source of Freddy's power to manipulate our physical reality. Without them... he's powerless -- nothing more than a bad dream. (off Jesse's cynical look) Hey, like I said... I don't make the rules.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we've still got a chance, right? A chance to kill Freddy before he gets back his power?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We already tried that. There's no way for us to kill Freddy. He's too clever. He knows how to get to us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then let's get somebody else. Some- body strong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah! We could hire somebody to kill Freddy -- like a hit man!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You would have to hire a thousand of them... or one really big guy who isn't afraid of anything. No fear. Nada. Then you got a shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going to find a hit man? The yellow pages? In your dreams... Jesse's last three words strike Meagan like a thunder- bolt and she stammers out a name:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason Voorhees...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason Voorhees... that's brilliant! The perfect dream warrior... no fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like our man!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... excuse me, Einstein... but isn't Jason Voorhees dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seriously dead. Buried up by Crystal Lake somewhere. But don't worry, I know how to bring him back to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somehow I just knew you would.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that's not the problem. The problem is control. Once we bring Jason back from the dead... I'm not one hundred percent sure he'll do what we tell him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's okay... as long as he doesn't chop us all up. Erwin rolls his eyes around -- uncertain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Erwin... I'm trusting you on this, so tell me the truth. Do you think if we do this -- if we go and get Jason and bring him back to life, that he could kill Freddy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No doubt about. Jason could wreck Freddy on this side of the Dreamline. But if Freddy has home court advan- tage... I don't know. Too close to call. The trick would be to get Jason to enter a dream state, grab Freddy, and drag him out to our reality.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't got a choice. I've got to try something... (turns to Stormie & Jesse) I can't ask either of you to help me do this... it's illegal, immoral, disgusting...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, we sisters have to stand together, right? Where you lead -- I'll follow. Count me in. Meagan embraces Stormie, then all three turn to Jesse. He looks them over and sighs:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me get this straight... we're going to go dig one dead maniac up to fight another dead maniac?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's about the size of it... and I'd be doing you a disservice if I said there weren't a modicum of risk involved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan... I don't want to do this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to, Jesse... it's not your fight. I understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I damn sure don't want you to do it without me. Count me in. Meagan hugs Jesse.  Erwin tries to hug Stormie but she pushes him away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look out Freddy... here we come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In his shack, listening to a small portable radio, is the NIGHT WATCHMAN.  His small DOG suddenly perks up her ears and GROWLS low.  The watchman turns down the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's matter, girl... you hear somethin'? Then the old man hears it, too... A low RUMBLE. Moving closer. The night watchman steps out of his shack and squints into the darkness when a line of several hearses approaches.  The lead hearse pulls up to the shack and the driver's window rolls down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this? A funeral procession? A Freddy cultist sticks his face out of the window and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's exactly what it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? Whose?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! -- the cultist SHOOTS the old man right through the head.  The night watchman falls to the ground with a lifeless THUD.  The little dog starts BARKING ferociously when another SHOT silences her as well. Another cultist leaps out of the hearse and runs to the gate, cutting the chain with a pair of bolt cutters.  He swings the gate open and the funeral procession proceeds inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cultists are standing around a small pit that two cultists are carefully excavating in the center of the wrecking yard.  Inside the pit, the uncovered remains of Freddy Krueger -- nothing more than a pile of charred bones. Lizzy is brought forward, held by a couple cultists, and injected with dream dope as the needle is passed around.  She no longer struggles, accepting her fate with droopy eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- as she watches one of the cultists reach down and put a rusty funnel into Freddy's broken jawbone.  Her vision gets blurry... more surreal as another cult member steps forward with the tupperware.  He pours the dream demons into the funnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the dream demons swim around inside his skull.  His bones start to bleed... blood becoming arteries and veins... vessels becoming muscle... muscle growing scarred flesh... There is a FLASH from the pit.  Then suddenly, Freddy Krueger -- as you've known him, as you've loved him -- leaps out of the pit and cries:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smokin'! Lizzy rolls her eyes up and faints.  The cultists
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: their weapons into the air and cheer as the building-high stacks of wrecked cars surrounding them HONK their HORNS and FLASH their LIGHTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Headlights as Jesse's car zooms past a sign that reads: CRYSTAL LAKE - 13 MILES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're almost there...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should pull over and ask directions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it doesn't offend the men... ooops, sorry! There aren't any.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very funny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse pulls the car into an ol' run-down service station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think they're open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It says, open all night. Jesse HONKS the horn and yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Can we get some service out here?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think there's anybody here... Suddenly, a CRAZY OL' COOT appears on the opposite side with a shotgun.  Everyone in the car jumps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you kids want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're looking for the old cemetery that's supposed to be around here... somewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want to know for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We want to see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't nothin' to see, girly... 'cept a bunch of ol' graves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, mister... can you give us directions or not? The old man gives the occupants of the car a going over with his one good eye, hesitating a moment over Erwin, who scrunches down in the back seat, hiding under a baseball cap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not goin' up there to do somethin' stupid, are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stupid? Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like dig up Jason Voorhees -- that's what! Everyone in the car takes a sharp breath -- cold busted!  Then they start saying "No! No!" and shaking their heads innocently in a big performance that wouldn't fool a stick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus... why would anyone do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno... but people do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Been dug up a few times already, has he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More times than I care to remember.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we're just doing an article for our high school newspaper about the dangers of breaking into cemeteries at night. You know, stuff that can get you hurt... The ol' coot scans the foursome again closely as he acquiesces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... okay... as long as you're not going up there to do something stupid. (pointing) Take this road up about a mile and make a left at the ol' saw mill. That road will take you right on in... Eternal Peace Cemetery -- can't miss it. Jesse is already standing on the gas, leaving the ol' coot standing in a cloud of smoke and dust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Headlights skew across a rusty iron gateway -- ETERNAL PEACE CEMETERY -- illuminating a sign: TRESPASSERS WILL BE SHOT! Meagan, Jesse, Stormie, and Erwin enter the shadowy cemetery carrying lamps with shovels over their shoulders.  As they search through the cemetery, Meagan asks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the story on Jason Voorhees anyway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where have you been? Jason was that guy who ran around in a hockey mask, chopping up camp counselors, duh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew that. What I mean was why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It started a long time ago, back in the fifties, when Jason drown at Camp Crystal Lake. His mother went berserk and started killing the counselors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She got her head chopped off by one of the girls she was trying to kill!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. And then Jason came back from his watery grave to get revenge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He came back from the grave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Chopped up a number of people before they finally caught up to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to him then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They killed him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you kill somebody who's back from the grave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not very well apparently. Jason keeps coming back to life and chopping people up. It's a never ending cycle of terror up here at Crystal Lake -- a real problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why does he keep coming back to life and killing people?
