direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say he's looking for revenge on the camp counselor who murdered him as a child. Jason just happens to go about it in the socially unacceptable way of hacking through every teenager he finds until he gets the right one. (spots grave) Here it is... Erwin shines his light on Jason's grave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Born:1945. Died:1953. Beneath the death date, crudely scratched into the stone: 1981, 1982, 1984, 1985, 1986, 1988, etc. Jesse and Erwin start digging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cemetery statues watching them dig. Stormie and Meagan take their turn.  Then... Jesse hits something solid. Hands brush away the remaining dirt, exposing the coffin below.  Jesse takes a sharp breath and then jams a crowbar under the lid -- forcing it open. The casket lid cracks open a bit when -- SSSSSS! -- noxious gas escapes.  Everyone covers their mouth and nose, suppressing the urge to hurl. Then roaches... hundreds of roaches. Meagan and Stormie run off, screaming, batting at their hair and clothing.  Jesse rolls around on the ground.  Erwin sighs, plucks a roach off his shirt, and calmly eats it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan and Stormie stand just outside the grave, holding the light and a can of bug spray.  Their hair is up, covered in plastic shower caps.  Duct tape around the cuffs of their pants.  They aren't taking anymore chances with bugs. Jesse and Erwin open the casket.  Everyone recoils at the stench.  Then they shine their lights inside
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nothing but rotting chunks and a broken hockey mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kids putting several plastic trash bags full of Jason into the trunk of Jesse's car and slamming the lid closed. Everyone piles into the car, exhausted. In the back, Erwin picks his nose, unaware that Stormie is watching him, her mouth gaping in horror. Erwin becomes aware of Stormie's sickened scrutiny and pulls out his finger, presenting it to Stormie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look... the boogerman! (laughs) Get it?! Stormie slaps his hand away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get back, you nasty-ass bastard! Ug! I thought I had seen the last of those when my brother graduated third grade!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We just dug up a rotting corpse and you're worried about a little snot. Jesse looks over at Meagan, curled up in a ball beside him.  She purrs:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm exhausted... wake me when we get back home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uhhh... better not fall asleep -- we've still got a lot of work to do and Freddy's out there... waiting. This news sobers everyone up immediately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that means we've all got to stay awake!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duh?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know! We'll sing a song! (starts singing) Row! Row! Row your boat, gently down the stream. Merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily... life is but a dream. Come on, everybody! Meagan leads the none-too-enthusiastic group in another chorus of "Row Your Boat" as Jesse's car roars off into the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan is leaning up against the door, murmuring softly to herself as she drifts off to sleep:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily... life is but a dream. In the back seat, Erwin is nuzzled between Stormie's breasts, sucking his thumb.  Both are fast asleep. Jesse stares at the road ahead, his own eyelids drooping.  The car starts to weave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OUT WINDSHIELD -- we flash past Freddy holding a cardboard sign by the side of the road: WILL KILL FOR FOOD. Jesse shakes his head -- nah!  He tries to concentrate on the road, his eyelids falling once more. Jesse's car zooms past a billboard.  Behind the bill- board -- a highway patrol car, a radar gun sticking out of the driver's window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Jesse's car passes in the back- ground, the red digits cascading up. Freddy, now dressed as a highway patrolman, sits behind the wheel.  The radar gun's display is reflected in his mirrored shades.  It reads: KILL THEM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shouldn't dream and drive. Freddy starts the car and pulls out, but what comes out from behind the billboard isn't a patrol car -- it's Freddy's NIGHTMAREMOBILE -- big chrome pipes belching HELLFIRE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Jesse's eyelids close and his head nods forward, revealing the night- maremobile closing from behind fast. The nightmaremobile runs up to the back of Jesse's car just an inch from the bumper.  Freddy moves one of the dozen of levers on the dash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a small version of Freddy's glove.  It extends out towards the back of Jesse's car, one of the tiny knives inserting into the trunk lock and turning with a slight CLICK. The trunk lid opens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: INSIDE TRUNK -- the plastic bags with Jason's remains are moving!  Freddy works another level and the tiny glove slits each bag.  The various pieces of Jason (hands, boots, intestines, etc.) crawl out of the bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like the cat's out of the bag now! Freddy laughs as the tiny hand closes the trunk. The nightmaremobile pulls out from behind Jesse's car, BANGING into the rear quarter panel. WHAM! -- all four occupants of the car are jolted awake, startled.  Meagan looks out her window and sees the nightmaremobile as it closes in again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Freddy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  SPARKS fly.  Everyone screams.  Freddy laughs as he falls back for another shot.  Meagan sees the dozens of lost souls trapped in the back of the night- maremobile, staring out at her through the back window. A small yellow sign reads:  LOST SOULS ON BOARD. Jesse fights to keep the car on the road when suddenly, the pieces of Jason ATTACK, BURSTING from behind the back seat.  One hand crawls up the back of the front seat, leaping onto Jesse's throat.  Jason's intestines
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: out of the backseat, SLITHERING and SNAKING their way around Stormie and Erwin.  One of Jason's boots wiggles under the seat, making it's way towards the gas peddle.  The other boot is content to lay under the back window and kick Erwin in the head. As Meagan fights to pull Jason's hand of Jesse's face, she looks down and sees Jason's other hand between her legs.  Meagan screams. Jason's boot stomps on the gas and Jesse's car lurches forward with the acceleration. The nightmaremobile
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into the side of Jesse's car again, causing it to swerve violently from side to side. Inside the nightmaremobile, Freddy pulls another lever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as a panel opens up and a circular sawblade arm extends out, CUTTING into Jesse's car with a flurry of SPARKS.  Inside, Meagan screams as the saw blade just misses her leg,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: forward towards...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the saw blade CUTS into it.  The tire BLOWS and Jesse's car lurches off the road, veering into a tree line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! -- Jesse's car plows fender-first into a tree, the HORN stuck on, BLARING. Freddy laughs and kicks the nightmaremobile into overdrive, ROARING OFF and disappearing with an
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of FIRE that wisps away in an instant. In the distance -- an old farmhouse.  The lights go on inside. The passenger door opens and Meagan falls out onto the ground, bleeding from a slight scalp wound.  A rear door opens and Stormie and Erwin spill out, locked in embrace and not seriously hurt.  Meagan staggers around to the driver's side and opens the door.  Jesse is laying unconscious against the steering wheel. Meagan pulls him off the wheel and the HORN stops. Jesse is splattered with blood and his leg is a mess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse's hurt real bad... we've got to get him to a doctor. Through the farmhouse window, Erwin and Stormie see the farmer on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry... an ambulance is on the way. Meagan cradles Jesse's head in her hands, crying:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God... Jesse... Erwin goes to the trunk and opens it.  Inside -- the garbage bags with Jason's remains still inside -- untouched.  Erwin goes to Meagan and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan... listen to me... The cops are on their way. If they find me and Jason Voorhees in the trunk there, we're finished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go... get out of here. Take Jason and Stormie with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm staying with you. Erwin grabs the trash bags out of the trunk and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll call you at the hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somehow! Erwin takes off, disappearing with Jason's remains into the night as SIRENS WAIL in the distance -- growing close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse is laying in a hospital bed, his leg in a special tent.  Meagan and Stormie watch from the doorway as a DOCTOR checks Jesse's vitals.  As he finishes, Meagan asks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he going to be okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. But he needs a lot of rest. His leg is broken in four places and he has four broken ribs and a concussion. Meagan sits down next to Jesse, taking his hand. Stormie turns to the doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey doc, is there someplace I could get us something to eat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid the cafeteria is closed. There are some vending machines in the lobby. (to Meagan) I'll be back to check on him in a couple of hours. The doctor exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be right back... I'm goin' go score us some munchies. Meagan nods weakly.  Stormie exits.  Meagan lays her head on Jesse's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stormie is getting several bags of munchies out of the vending machine when she turns and sees Murdoch at the information booth, flashing photos of Jesse and Erwin. Stormie dashes for the staircase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse and Meagan have fallen asleep.  Jesse's heart monitor BEEPS... On the wall, an x-ray viewer flickers to life.  Freddy peeks out from behind the other side.  He snickers and ducks back down. Suddenly, Freddy's hand reaches up from inside the bed and grabs Jesse, pulling him down into the mattress. Meagan wakes and sees this, screaming as Jesse grabs onto the curtain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the curtain pulls free of the rings. Jesse disappears into the bed, his screams echoing away. Meagan looks under the bed -- nothing.  She rises up again, watching as Jesse's iv and electrode wires are pulled down after him.  Meagan grabs a handful of tubes and wire and tries to pull Jesse back.  But the pull is too strong and Meagan goes into the mattress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan falls to the floor of a dusty ol' saloon.  As she gets to her feet she sees Jesse's iv tubes running along the floor and out the door.  Meagan follows them to the saloon door, where she stops and looks out into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Standing in the middle of the street is Jesse, dressed in a cowboy sheriff's outfit complete with hat, badge, and gunbelt. Meagan calls to him from the saloon door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse! But Jesse can't hear her.  He's too busy shaking with fear... staring at something coming down the street. It's Freddy.  Dressed in a Black Bart cowboy outfit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Sheriff... This nightmare ain't big enough for the two of us... draw! Trembling with fear, Jesse fumbles for his pistol. He pulls it out and FIRES.  Freddy laughs.  Jesse
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: again.  Freddy just laughs.  Jesse FIRES again and again and again and Freddy just laughs and laughs and laughs.  From the saloon, Meagan screams:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse! Wake up! Wake up!! Freddy looks over at her, annoyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three's a crowd, bitch! Why don't you just go get [BEEP]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SOUND of Jesse's heart monitor BEEPING erratically wakes Meagan with a start.  She tries to wake Jesse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse, wake up! WAKE UP!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse keeps FIRING at Freddy... until his gun CLICKS empty.  Freddy smiles and pulls out the biggest Goddamn gun you ever saw and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead... make my dream! Freddy FIRES!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse's stomach EXPLODES with BLOOD -- splattering Meagan.  Jesse's heart monitor BEEPS continuously -- flat line.  Jesse is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shows up to answer the alarm.  She sees Meagan standing over Jesse's body, covered in blood, and screams. Stormie enters the room a half-second later and gasps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freddy killed Jesse... Stormie reaches in and grabs Meagan, pulling her out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stormie drags a shell-shocked Meagan down the hall, the screams of the nurse fading into the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus... get a grip, lady. You'd think a nurse in a hospital would have seen a dead body before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesse... Just then, Stormie spots Murdoch and his men getting off the elevator.  They hear the nurse's screams and come running towards Jesse's room.  Stormie pulls Meagan behind the nurse's station just as Murdoch and company go thundering past. Then a VOICE on the P.A. says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attention. Would Meagan or Stormie please pick up the white paging phone for a message? Stormie and Meagan exchange worrisome looks.  The announcement repeats itself again.  Then again. Stormie can't stand it anymore -- she stands up and picks up the white paging phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Stormie... Murdoch and his men come running past the nurse's station again.  Stormie turns her back to them but Murdoch goes back to the nurse's station, asking:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you see a couple of girls go by here a moment ago? Stormie gestures to the elevators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just missed 'em. Murdoch nods a quick thanks and takes off with his men right behind.  Stormie exhales a giant sigh of relief as the HOSPITAL OPERATOR says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The message is from Erwin... he says to meet him at the side entrance in two minutes. Stormie hangs up and grabs Meagan, running for the staircase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - MOMENTS LATER Stormie drags Meagan out of the hospital just as Erwin pulls up in an old battered pick-up truck. He throws open the door and Stormie pushes Meagan inside, climbing in after her and asking:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you get the truck?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Same place I've got Jason hid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And where's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A place where no one ever goes. Stormie closes the door and the pick-up truck ROARS out of the parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pick-up truck's headlights skew across a weather- worn sign, peppered with bullet holes: CAMP CRYSTAL LAKE Erwin drives the truck through the deserted camp, past the cabins, down towards the lake.  He stops a short distance away from the pier and the three of them climb out. Meagan is still in shock, letting Stormie guide her as Erwin leads them down the pier to a small diving platform tied up to the end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you do -- take him for a swim?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost. Erwin jumps down on the diving platform.  In the center, a large form is covered by a tarp.  Erwin helps Stormie down onto the platform, leaving Meagan standing on the pier.  She looks out over the lake -- eyes vacant. Erwin moves close to Stormie and, gesturing to Meagan, asks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is she going to be alright?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. She's pretty fucked up. God, I don't know why I'm not...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a strong woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that supposed to mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uhhh... nothing. I didn't mean anything. Stormie gestures to the tarp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... (whips back tarp) Meet the new and improved Jason.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: laying spread eagle on the diving platform, cocooned in chicken wire with dozens of coiled leads trailing off into the water.  Erwin has done a good job of sewing Jason back together with barbed wire and fishing line.  His arms and legs have been reinforced with steel braces and even Jason's mask has been repaired, stitched down the middle with bailing wire.  Jason looks nineties... and butch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you put that stupid mask on him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a look... Stormie bends down and takes a peek under the mask and quickly replaces it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not exactly a beauty queen entry, is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what do we do now -- sing an Ozzy Osbourne song backwards or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid it's not that simple...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you said you knew how to bring him back to life?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do! But when I was putting him back together, I noticed something was missing. Stormie thinks about this for a second, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Awwww, he won't be needing that... I mean, what girl would let him put his rotten ol'...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No-no! Not that! It's his heart... it's missing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... does it really matter? Can't you use an aquarium pump or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... he has to have a heart. A human heart. A good one. Meagan speaks for the first time:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know where we can get a heart... A good one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sign reads: CITY MORGUE.  Through the front window a GUARD can be seen sitting at the reception desk. Erwin, Stormie, and Meagan watch him from the pick-up, parked a safe distance away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That guard in there might pose a problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think you and Stormie could keep him occupied for a few minutes? Erwin and Stormie exchange looks, then shrug -- why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... let's do it. A few moments later, the guard looks up as the pick- up swerves wildly into the parking lot.  He gets up and goes to the glass door, peering out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THROUGH GLASS DOOR as Stormie and Erwin start making out -- hot and heavy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan BREAKS a small window near the ceiling. She crawls onto the top of the cabinet and then drops to the floor.  She shines her flashlight around the dark laboratory, illuminating anatomy charts, jars full of organs, etc. Crossing to the lockers, Meagan tentatively opens one of the drawers and shines her light inside -- ug!  Wrong guy.  She opens the next drawer -- ick! Even worse. Meagan opens a third drawer -- Jesse.  Her lip starts to quiver as she caresses his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the glass door, the guard is watching the action in the parking lot, his breath fogging the window. He wipes the glass clean with his sleeve to get a better look. Inside the truck, Stormie and Erwin wrestle around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Watch that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just trying to make it look real.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just keep your hands above the bra, pizza face. The windows are starting to steam up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan pulls on a labcoat and puts on a pair of rubber gloves.  Then she opens a drawer full of shiny instru- ments (saws, rib cutters, etc.) and selects a large knife. Meagan stands over Jesse's body.  She pulls back the sheet, exposing his chest.  Meagan raises the knife far above her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me, Jesse... Meagan plunges the knife into Jesse's chest with a sickening THWACK!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The windows of the pick-up are now badly fogged, obscuring the guard's view.  He licks his lips, deciding to investigate closer.  The guard unlocks the front door and starts toward Stormie and Erwin. They spot him coming and break their embrace.  In another moment, the pick-up is PEELING out of the parking lot.  The guard watches the truck go, shakes his head, and goes back inside to start his rounds. Up the street, parked with the lights off in the night shade of a large tree, Stormie and Erwin watch as the guard starts down the glass enclosed hallway towards the morgue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's head right for her! Do some- thing! Erwin panics for a moment, then HONKS the HORN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan is trying to pull Jesse's heart out of his chest but it just won't come, some vein or muscle fiber keeps pulling it back.  She jumps at the HORN, then starts pulling harder. In the hallway just outside, the guard hears the HORN and stops.  He starts back for the front, when suddenly the HORN stops. Meagan hacks at the last bits of stringy goo that cling to Jesse's heart.  As the last strand goes, Meagan tumbles backwards to the floor with a loud THUD. The guard hears that and turns back towards the morgue, drawing his gun.  He tip-toes to the door and carefully unlocks it, leaving his keys in the lock.  Taking a two-handed Weaver stance, the guard raises his foot and kicks the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! -- the door flies open and the guard leaps inside like Marshall Dillon, snapping on the lights. He gasps, eyes going wide as he scans the room.  One of the drawers is open... the stiff's chest has got a huge hole in it... blood spattered everywhere... a bunch of bloody footprints leading over to the cabinet... Suddenly, the guard sees Meagan half out the window and cries:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop right there! Meagan rolls out of the window just as the guard FIRES. The unbroken section of the window SHATTERS.  The guard curses and races for the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guard comes running out just in time to see Meagan close the passenger door and the truck ROAR away.  He shrinks, dejected -- no way to catch them now.  The guard heads back inside to report this mess and finds that the door has closed and locked behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crazy ol' coot is leading Murdoch through the cemetery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They said they were writin' for some newspaper...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Teenagers are notorious liars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, after I heard about the accident on my police scanner, I came up here to have a look. When I found it I figured you'd want to know right away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did the right thing. The ol' coot shines his light down into Jason's empty grave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn kids... I just knew they were comin' up here to do somethin' stupid. The S.W.A.T. commander comes up to Murdoch. S.W.A.T. COMMANDER Just got a call on the radio -- three juveniles just broke into the morgue -- one male, two female. The guard is pretty sure the male is in the Freddy cult -- burnt face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like the same kids I saw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did the guard say what they took? S.W.A.T. COMMANDER Yeah... that murdered kid, Jesse -- they carved his heart out. (beat) They got away in a pick-up -- the guard didn't get the license. You want me to put out an A.P.B.?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... that won't be necessary. I know just where they're going, and just what they're up to. And this time... I'll be ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan sits on the end of the pier, watching silently as Erwin sews Jesse's heart into Jason's chest using dental floss.  Stormie comes up behind her and puts her jacket around Meagan's shoulders, sits down beside her and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got to quit blaming your- self for what happened to Jesse... it wasn't your fault.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't want to come with us... but he did anyway. He did it for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sorry I came... I don't think Jesse would be, either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just can't believe he's dead. I keep thinking he'll show up any minute...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that just about does it... Erwin finishes sewing up Jason and climbs back onto the pier, cutting the diving platform free.  He kicks it off and it floats out into the lake, drifting free. Then Erwin herds the girls down the shore, leading them over to where a short trench has been dug leading from the water's edge. In the bottom of the trench -- an uncovered power cable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you can see, I've excavated the power cable that runs across the bottom of Crystal Lake. I've cut away the insulation, exposing a patch of cable right near the water's edge. Erwin picks up a nearby bucket of water and sets it at the head of the trench.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now when I kick this over, the water will wash down the trench and bridge an eletrical gap between the cable and the lake. There's plenty of voltage, so it should work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you kick the bucket and Jason lives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, right... (then) Okay, keep your fingers crossed... Erwin kicks the bucket over.  The water washes down the trench, over the cable, and -- POW! Z-Z-Z-ZAP! A huge SPARK HITS EXPLODES.  Then the lake begins to glow and the water begins to churn.  Erwin and the girls jump back as ELECTRICITY ARCS from the lake, engulfing the diving platform. The ARCS of ELECTRICITY leap from the chicken wire onto Jason's body, his massive frame convulsing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as we PUSH IN -- the electricity spirals down into the eye hole like water running down a drain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as it opens!  We dive into the eye and take a fantastic dream/time travel to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 1953 - DAY CLOSE ON MASK (1950's version of a hockey mask) reflected in the water.  A young hand reaches up and pulls off the mask, revealing the disfigured boy beneath.  This is JASON -- AGE 9.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes to the doorway of their run- down cabin in dirty longjohns, holding a bottle of rye. He bellows:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason! Git your ass over here! Jason jumps at his father's voice, hesitates only slightly, then runs toward him, stopping abruptly several paces away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did I teach you, boy? Don't ever take your mask off out in public. I don't want nobody to see that ugly mug of yours. Jason stands, looking at his bare feet. His father smacks him upside the head, shoving him towards the woodshed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go git in the woodshed. Jason's pace slows as he enters the dark shed -- he knows what's coming next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drop them overalls and lay over them logs... Jason slowly complies as his father loosens his belt. Suddenly, JASON'S MOTHER is just outside the doorway, calling:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason! Come here! Jason gives his father a sideways glance, then scurries towards his mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing woman? Jason's mother gives him a mason jar stuffed with dollars and change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saved up some money... I want you to take and go on up to that summer camp just up the road. Tell the man you want to stay there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just what the hell do you think you're doing, bitch?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sending him away for a few weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ain't sending him nowhere. (to Jason) Bring me that money, boy! Jason holds his ground for a second, unsure whom to obey, when his mother shoos him away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on now... go! Jason takes off up the road.  His father sneers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goin' ag'in me? I'll take you to the shed, woman! Jason's mother pulls a knife from her apron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ain't ever taking anyone to the shed ever again. Jason's mother charges at her husband, shoving him back into the shed with the knife.  Jason looks back. Through the open window he sees his mother's arm coming down repeatedly with the knife, his father's arms flailing helplessly.  Then both disappear from view.  After a moment his mother appears in the door- way, spattered with blood.  She smiles and waves to him, calling:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on, son... have a good time! Mommy will come and git you some day soon! Jason turns and runs to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 1953 - DAY Wearing his mask, Jason walks through the entrance to the camp with his jar of money. In the office, the HEAD COUNSELOR takes his money and shakes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome aboard, son! I'm sure you'll have a great time!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The other KIDS dance around Jason, taunting him... laughing at him... pointing and teasing... Jason breaks away, running towards the pier. Jason sits at the end of the pier, looking at his own reflection.  He removes the mask and watches as the distortions in the water make his face look normal. Someone comes up behind Jason slowly.  Jason isn't aware of their presence until a shadowy reflection appears behind his own.  Jason turns to see who when he is suddenly pushed into the lake. Jason splashes to the surface, sputtering, trying to stay afloat.  A hand pushes his head back under the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: P.O.V. -- a distorted image of whoever is holding him under. Jason thrusts out his arms, fighting to get back to the surface... fighting just to see who is killing him before he dies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason comes alive, thrashing around on the diving dock, the electricity all over him like a spider web. On shore, Erwin and the girls gasp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit! It worked! Meagan and Stormie bounce, excitedly.  But something is wrong.  Jason thrashes around on the dock, unable to break the crisscross of high voltage chicken wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's kill him! Shut it off! Shut it off!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut it off... it suddenly occurs to me that I hadn't really planned for that contingency.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just don't stand there! Do something! But all Erwin can do is scratch his head.  Meagan rushes to the shore line and screams out over the lake:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason! JASON! You've got to get up! Do you hear me? Get up! Jason clenches his meaty fists and SLAMS them down against the diving dock. SMASHING it to bits.  Water rushes over him and -- ZZZZT! KA-POW! A power transformer on shore EXPLODES, causing Meagan and her friends to cringe.  When they look back, the electrical light show fades away, leaving nothing but smoke and floating debris.  Meagan and Stormie turn to Erwin, who shrugs shyly and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... it's off now. Meagan and Stormie begin a verbal barrage that would shrink any man to pus... much less Erwin.  He cowers between them, offering quick excuses and humble apologies. All three are so wrapped up in laying blame that they never notice Jason's shadowy figure as it rises from the lake. Then they do see him... scream and run.  Jason charges after the kids in his familiar "unstoppable killer" gait. Erwin ducks inside the tool shed as Meagan and Stormie dash past.  He closes the door behind him and squirms out a tiny window just as Jason kicks open the door and steps inside.  Erwin races around to the front and closes the door.  He fastens the latch and padlock, then calls to the girls:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Come back! I've got him locked up in the tool shed! Just then, the SOUND of a CHAINSAW as the blade RIPS through the tool shed door.  Erwin screams like a girl and runs away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan and Stormie run into the main room.  Stormie spots a phone and goes to it, dialing frantically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you calling?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cops! Who else?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you kidding?! They'll lock us up and throw away the key!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine by me! (clicks the receiver) Damnit! It's dead! Just then, Erwin bursts into the cabin, slamming the door shut behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's right behind me! Stormie and Meagan look out the window -- sure enough, Jason is storming towards them, holding the chainsaw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the one who brought him back to life!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, do something! Erwin screams and runs for the closet, hiding inside. Stormie clucks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, some hero! Just then, the chainsaw RIPS through the front door. Meagan and Stormie scream and follow Erwin into the closet, closing themselves inside. They cower in the closet, listening... for a long moment... nothing but the sound of their heavy breathing. Then, with the RIPPING of WOOD, Jason chainsaws the closet door -- knocking it to the floor.  Erwin draws out his pin and starts stabbing himself in the finger. Jason charges forward, when Meagan suddenly stands up in front of him and yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! To everyone's shock... Jason does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now... just stop! We're the ones that brought you back to life. And you have no right to kill us with that chainsaw! In fact... you owe us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right! She gave you her boyfriend's heart, you know!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. Jason cocks his massive head like a perplexed pup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look! Here's his picture... Meagan takes off the necklace that Jesse gave her and opens the locket.  She shows Jason the photo of Jesse inside.  Jason drops the chainsaw and takes the locket in his humongous hands, gently touching the photo of Jesse with a meaty finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, I know that you've been through a lot. And I know that you're pissed off about being murdered and all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know I would be!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if you help us kill Freddy Krueger... I promise to help you find the little bastard that killed you. What do you say? Have we got a deal? Meagan sticks out her hand to shake.  Jason stares at it, looks back at the locket, then to Meagan. Finally, he reaches out his huge hand for Meagan's when... Brilliant, blinding white light blazes through the windows, freezing everyone to the spot.  Anxious to get out of the closet with Jason, Erwin crawls across the floor and peeks out over the window sill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OUT WINDOW -- a dozen police cars shine their lights towards the cabin, two dozen COPS aim their weapons.  In the middle of this impressive show of force is Murdoch.  He raises a bullhorn to his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You in there! This is Captain Renton Murdoch -- State Trooper! I am ordering you to come out with your hands up! I'll give you until the count of three... (beat) Three! Meagan turns to Jason, shoving him back into the closet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason, you have to hide! Stay in here and don't come out until we tell you. Stormie... help me! Stormie helps Meagan stuff Jason into the closet, closing the door.  Then they quickly smooth down their hair and clothes, moving towards the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan, Stormie, and Erwin come out with their hands raised high above their heads.  As they walk towards the police cars, several of the S.W.A.T. team moves in and arrests them.  As they are handcuffed and searched, Murdoch goes on the bullhorn again:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright... anybody else left in there had better say their prayers!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no one else inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that a fact? (into bullhorn) Okay... you had your chance! Suddenly, one of the cops points towards the cabin and shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, look! All heads turn towards the cabin, where Jason's massive frame is filling the doorway. S.W.A.T. COMMANDER Holy Mary, mother of God... would you look at the size of that guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew it! All the cops level their weapons at Jason when Murdoch suddenly steps forward, gesturing for everyone to get behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stand back! I'll handle this. Murdoch takes a few steps towards the cabin and sneers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You... Jason raises the chainsaw -- he remembers Murdoch too. Murdoch goes for his gun, but instead of bringing out a pistol, he holds a laser designator.  Murdoch fires. A big red dot appears on Jason's chest.  Jason looks down at it like it was a harmless bug.  He looks back up at Murdoch, who raises a radio to his lips and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let her go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A military jet flying above drops it's payload -- a laser-guided napalm bomb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A slight WHISTLE sound grows in the skies above Camp Crystal Lake.  Jason looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as it drops down on Jason -- homing in on the laser dot on his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! -- Camp Crystal Lake EXPLODES in flames. All the cops take cover as FIRE RAINS DOWN on them. Only Murdoch stands his ground, his arms outstretched as he embraces the terrible sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That'll teach you to fuck with the law, Voorhees! A cop behind him says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uhh, sir... your hat's on fire. Murdoch looks up -- sure enough, his Smokey Bear hat is burning above the brim. Meagan watches as Camp Crystal Lake is consume in flames, her last hope of saving Lizzy -- gone.  Then a cop shoves her into a police car with Stormie. Erwin is put into another car and the three exchange worrisome looks through the windows just before the cars pull away. As the cops start to pull out, one of them notices something moving amidst the flames -- a large BURNING form, walking towards the lake.  As it stumbles out onto the pier, the cop turns to his partner and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey... do you see that? But just then, the form falls through the BURNING pier, SPLASHING into the water below.  The partner looks, sees nothing, and shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought I saw something... He shrugs it off and exits after his partner. Murdoch, his hat still smoking a little, surveys the sight one last time before climbing into his patrol car and driving away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A cell door SLAMS in front of Stormie's face. A cell door SLAMS in front of Meagan's face.  Both girls are behind bars, separated by a cement wall.  The hefty female DEPUTY in charge of the cellblock goes back to her desk. Both girls stand in their cells next to eachother, watching as the deputy goes back to her desk and begins to devour three combo-burritos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got to try and stay awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Getting something to eat might help. (calls to Deputy) Yo, Butch!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Deputy Miller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, Deputy Miller but could we have something to eat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you psychos only ate human hearts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I thought you pigs only ate donuts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't make me come back there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cow! I hope she chokes on her three combo-burrito cud! Meagan leans up against the wall, sliding down to the floor in defeat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I going to do? I'll never be able to find Lizzy now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should be worrying about your- self... I know I am. Stormie plops down on her cot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet you're sorry you came with me now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah... what are best friends for? Afterall, you stuck by me through all my crazy phases, I figure I owe you one big crazy phase, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's for being my best friend, Stormie. Just then, Deputy Miller steps in front of Meagan's cell, unlocking it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Meagan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your parents are here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - MOMENTS LATER Deputy Miller brings Meagan out of the cellblock, where her mom and dad are waiting with Captain Murdoch. Meagan's mom rushes up and hugs Meagan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Meagan... are you alright? Let me look at you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm okay, mom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother's been worried sick, Meagan. So have I. Meagan stands handcuffed, her hair mussed, her clothes bloody and soiled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. Today has been a bitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The deputy is so busy munching down on her burritos that she doesn't notice the strange shadow that passes behind her. The shadow moves down the cellblock, accompanied by a slight SCRAPING.  Freddy's glove materializes, raking the knives along the metal cross bars.  Freddy stops at Stormie's cell, looking inside. Stormie is fast asleep. Freddy walks into Stormie's cell, passing right through the bars.  Suddenly, Stormie wakes and, seeing Freddy, jumps to her feet and screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help! Help! Freddy's here! He's here! But the deputy at the end of the cellblock doesn't respond, finishing off the rest of the burrito and licking her meaty fingers clean.  Freddy puts his forefinger knife to his lips and shushes Stormie, pointing to her cot.  Stormie looks over and sees her- self asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, shit! I'm still asleep! She looks up at Freddy, who smiles and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what they say... when you sleep -- you die! Freddy flashes the glove of knives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan, Captain Murdoch here said you helped one of those cultists escape from a hospital?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mental hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he said you desecrated a cemetery and some other really terrible things. Tell me you had nothing to do with it. Tell me there's some mistake...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no mistake. (to Murdoch) What did you do with Erwin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your boyfriend is headed back to the looney bin where he belongs. But don't worry, you'll be seeing him soon enough... at the arraignment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freddy taunts Stormie as the circle around in the cell by slicing off his fingers, squirting green slime. Stormie winces a little but keeps her distance and cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't scare me, Freddy! Thanks to my various phases and many hours of watching violent televison, I have become immune to violence. Seen it all and done it all! Nothing you do can gross me out -- so why don't you give it your best shot, bitch!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then maybe I'll just CUT to the chase! Freddy swings the glove but Stormie ducks, keeping her defensive stance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm warning you, Freddy... my father is a drill sergeant in the Marine Corps and he taught me just how to defend myself against slimy bastards like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh I'm so scared, honey. Come on! Hit me! Punch me right in the nose! I dare you! Freddy juts out his chin, gesturing for Stormie to take a punch.  Stormie throws a right and pops Freddy right in the nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Owwwww! Stormie smiles but that soon fades as she realizes her fist is stuck in Freddy's nose.  Freddy takes in a breath and Stormie's arm is sucked up past the elbow. She screams. Freddy takes a deep breath and snorts Stormie right up his nose, her screams turning into a faint BUZZ. Freddy smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now that's what I call getting a buzz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now the size of a flea, Stormie is clinging to one of hundreds of pointed tree trunks jutting out from the circular walls -- Freddy's nose hairs.  Stuck in those humongous hairs are clumps of icky gunk -- boogers. Sitting next to Stormie, a particularly large and rotund booger clump opens its eyes and says (in the distorted voice of Harry Manfredini):
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi there! I'm the Boogerman! Heh- heh... get it? Stormie screams, backing up into the "trees", trying to put distance between herself and Boogerman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aww, don't go... we can play "Star Wars". You can be Princess Leia and I'll be Jabba the Hutt! Boogerman licks his fat, nasty lips with a slimy green tongue -- he does kinda look like Jabba.  Stormie screams again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan is getting more and more agitated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're wasting time! We've got to close down all the churches -- Freddy has to marry Lizzy on holy ground! Meagan's parents stare at their daughter with confused, frightened looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you understand?! He has to come to our reality to do it! It's our last chance to kill him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, I think we've heard enough of this crap. Take her back to the lockup. A couple of DEPUTIES grab Meagan.  She throws them off and they grab her again, roughly.  Meagan's parents watch in pain and horror as the deputies drag their daughter back to her cell, kicking and screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad! Mom! Don't let them lock me up! I have to save Lizzy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Meagan... you're sick. You don't even realize what you've done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did what I had to do to try and save Lizzy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, including murdering your boy- friend and cutting his heart out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Liar! Freddy killed Jesse! He was already dead when I cut his heart out! Meagan's mom and dad gasp, recoiling with horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamnit, you don't understand! Freddy lives! FREDDY LIVES!!! Meagan's raving grows faint as she disappears into the cellblock.  Murdoch pulls Meagan's dad aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know how you must feel... I had a dog once. I loved that dog. I treated her like my own daughter. We went camping, picnics in the park... I even had a little stocking for her nailed up on the mantle for Christmas. Then one day, she bit me... so I had to blow her brains out. (sighs) God, I loved that dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & NOSTRIL CAVERN - SAME TIME Freddy starts to dig in his nose with his forefinger knife. A giant knife blade comes charging up the nostril cavern, sending Stormie into hysterics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-oh, Freddy's picking his nose again -- gotta go! Boogerman starts lumbering up into the back of the nostril cavern.  Stormie watches the massive knife blade as it comes right for her, then at the last possible second she starts climbing after Boogerman. She pushes past the disgusting blob of goo, racing ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, excuse me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- Freddy pushes the knife way far back into his head. The giant knife spears Boogerman in the back, running him through and spilling his "Boogerman" guts out his front.  Stormie gives a little squeal as Boogerman is pulled out, kicking and screaming. Freddy withdraws the knife from his nose, peering closely at the tiny Boogerman impaled on the end. He twists his mouth in utter disdain and flicks Booger- man across the cell. Boogerman screams as he flies across vast space, smack- ing into the far wall with a giant SPLAT! Boogerman flattens outwards into a thin pancake of Boogerman goo, his nasty head still alive in the center. Freddy reaches through the bars of the cell, his arm extending out in a grotesque fashion all the way to the deputy's desk.  He feels around on the table until he touches the pepper shaker, drawing it back into Stormie's cell. Freddy sprinkles a small amount of pepper into his right palm and breathes it in deeply -- the specks of pepper becoming rocks that pelt Stormie as she clings to life deep inside the nostril. Freddy's face begins to distort, his nose wrinkling up -- the beginnings of a sneeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhh... ahhh... ahhh--CHOO! Micro-Stormie comes blasting out of Freddy's nose with globules of snot.  She flies across the massive cell, headed directly for the splattered Boogerman, screaming her head off. Boogerman sees Stormie racing towards him and he screams too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the deputy brings Meagan back to her cell they hear a loud SPLAT!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stormie?! The deputy pushes Meagan back as she moves forward cautiously, glancing around the wall into Stormie's cell... then promptly puking combo burrito.  Meagan runs up and looks.  The wall to Stormie's cell is splattered with blood and bits. Meagan falls to her knees, sobbing as more DEPUTIES come running into the cellblock, answering the deputy's puke-choked scream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God... what have I done? What have I done?! We BOOM OUT of this chaos and go to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An ambulance races along the road with it's emergency lights flashing.  In back Erwin lays strapped to a gurney.  Up front sit a DRIVER and an ATTENDANT.  They chat disparagingly about the freak in the back, when suddenly a large form appears in the road just ahead. The driver slams on the brakes and the wheels lock up with a terrible SQUEAL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! -- the ambulance plows into the form, knocking it some fifty feet down the road.  The driver and the attendant stare out of the cracked windshield in shock. Finally, the driver turns to the attendant and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll go check it out. You stay here. The driver gets out and goes to the form laying in the road.  He bends down to examine the charred, mammoth carcass when a fist flies up, smacking the driver in the face.  He falls to the ground, unconscious. The corpse sits up in the glare from the headlights -- it's Jason!  Burnt and blackened but ready for action! He starts towards the ambulance. The attendant gets out and pulls his service revolver, emptying into Jason's chest.  Jason recoils only slightly as BULLET HITS BURST his coveralls, then he grabs the attendant by the head as he snaps the empty pistol in panic.  Jason slams the attendant's face into the side of the ambulance. In the back of the ambulance, a terror-stricken Erwin watches as a face shaped dent appears in the wall with a sickening WRENCHING of METAL and FLESH.  Then... silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! -- Jason pulls off the back door of the ambulance and climbs inside, the shocks bottoming out under his weight.  He reaches out for Erwin, who closes his eyes... waiting for the inevitable. Then... nothing. After a second, Erwin opens an eye.  Jason is standing over him, hand outstretched.  In his big, burnt palm
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan's necklace.  Erwin looks from the necklace to Jason.  Jason thrusts out his hand impatiently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You... want me to tell you where Meagan is? Again with the thrusting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well why didn't you say so?! Jesus, for a minute there I thought you were going to kill me. (then) You're not, are you? Jason shakes his palm at Erwin yet a third time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... okay! I'll take you right to her. Could you help me out of this? Jason reaches over and yanks out the gurney straps. Erwin exits out the back with Jason following close behind.  Erwin climbs in behind the wheel, saying:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll drive. Jason pushes Erwin aside so roughly that he slams into the passenger side door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... you drive. As Jason climbs into the driver's seat, a CHIME goes off as a female COMPUTER VOICE in a pleasant tone says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fasten your safety belt, please. Erwin fastens his.  Jason watches him and pulls the safety belt across his massive chest -- it won't reach. Jason pulls harder, ripping the belt out of the bolts. The CHIME goes crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fasten your safety belt, please... Fasten your safety belt, please... Jason SMASHES the dashboard with his fist, silencing the voice and chime.  He turns suddenly to Erwin as if to say, "Yeah?! What about it?"  Erwin shrugs nervously:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck the bitch. Let's roll! With tires SQUEALING, burning rubber and smoke, the ambulance roars away into the early morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan stares through the bars of her cell at the sun as it peeks out over the horizon.  The deputy gets up to leave for the six a.m. shift change.  As she goes, she switches on the cellblock TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An early morning religious program is on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Channel 12 -- Station W.G.O.D.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: where the "W" stands for "Worship" And now... "Daily Affirmation" with Reverend Lawrence Lovejoy... A shot of the REVEREND LOVEJOY at the podium in his studio, giving kind words of encouragement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning, friends... the Good Book says that each morning brings a new light into our lives... The good reverend goes on about it always being darkest before the dawn, have faith and your prayers will be answered, etc.  Meagan turns and watches the sunrise
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: glorious.  Tears stream down her cheeks.  Then a commercial comes on:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can own a videotape of Reverend Lovejoy's Daily Affirmation for only $19.95...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In his booth at the main gate, the GATE GUARD watches as a procession of hearses approaches.  As the first hearse reaches the gate, the guard steps out and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. What can I do for you? A cultist sticks his head out the window and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're here to see the Reverend Lovejoy. We need him to perform a wedding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have an appointment?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I have a Beretta. The cultist produces a pistol -- BANG!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The REVEREND LOVEJOY is at his podium, his WIFE at the organ, waiting for the commercial break to be over. The FLOOR MANAGER counts down -- three... two... one...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! -- the cultists burst into the studio.  The CAMERA OPERATOR and FLOOR MANAGER are killed.  The Reverend Lovejoy and his WIFE, at the organ, are taken hostage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the cultists take the reverend and his wife hostage.  Meagan watches, suddenly perplexed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cultists break into the control room, killing the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and STAFF.  One slips into the sound booth, garroting the RELIGIOUS ANNOUNCER with a piece of wire. Another SMASHES the control board, killing the signal. All the feed monitors go snowy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the picture goes to static.  Just then, the deputy appears in front of Meagan's cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something just happened at the TV station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about it -- get undressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time to get you cleaned up for court. Meagan looks back at the TV as she slowly starts to get undressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The deputy ushers Meagan into the showers.  Inside, a naked group of mean, nasty, ugly JAIL HOUSE BITCHES are showering, washing hairy pits, flabby tattooed skin, and greasy hair.  They eye Meagan like the dessert bar at Denny's as she crosses to the opposite side, sneaking into a corner.  Meagan turns on the shower and drops the towel -- the bitches whistle and catcall. Just then, the deputy gets called away, leaving Meagan to the mercy of the bitches.  The head bitch slides over to Meagan and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter, honey... you don't like our company?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like you... sure. It's just that I usually shower alone, that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh! So you're shy? I like 'em when they're shy... The head bitch grabs at Meagan, who resists.  But this bitch is big and tough and holds Meagan by the wrists as she tries to kiss her.  The other bitches laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't fight it, baby! You know you want me... Meagan scratches the head bitch's face.  She backs off screaming, wiping blood from her face.  Then she spits, reaches down (below the frame line) and produces a shiv.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you won't give me a piece then I'll just cut one for myself... The head bitch moves in.  Meagan takes a cautious step back, bumping into tile -- nowhere to go.  She holds up her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a second... I didn't mean to do that... I'm sorry. It's just that you come on a little strong, that's all. Just give me a little time to adjust to my new surroundings... The head bitch stops, curious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you saying you want me now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... I want you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prove it. Meagan comes up to the woman, raising her arms.  In a flash, the head bitch has the shiv to Meagan's jugular
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a warning.  Meagan carefully puts her arm around the bitch and kisses her full on the mouth.  After a long, uncomfortable moment, they break.  The head bitch smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now that's more like it! (to the others) Hey, this bitch is alright! The other bitches smile as the head bitch slips her arm around Meagan's waist and pulls her tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're okay, honey... what's your name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So... what're you in for, Meagan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my friend...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bitch that died last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... they said she had some disease that made her... explode! Oh, God! Please hold me! The head bitch holds Meagan tight as she sobs, smoothing her hair.  The other bitches share a look of concern as one asks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this bullshit about some killer funk make you explode?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy... honey. It's goin' be alright. But what I asked you is why you're in here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... well... the cops? Well, they think I gave it to her... The head bitch suddenly springs back as if Meagan were Satan himself.  She runs for the other bitches but they aren't having anything to do with her.  All the bitches race for the exit. The deputy comes to the shower room doorway and shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is all the screaming about?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! -- the bitches run her over, stripping the keys from her belt.  They unlock the cellblock door and go running into the police station, screaming butt-naked. After the bitches exit, Meagan's hand reaches out and drags the unconscious deputy into the shower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bitches come running butt-naked and screaming through the station.  Several deputies chase after them, tackle them and try to cuff them.  A brawl ensues.  Chaos. Murdoch sits on a desk, reading a report.  He looks up at the madness and mutters:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Punks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: enters the showers and sees a naked woman on top of a deputy, their arms locked in a struggle. The deputy cracks the naked woman in the back of the head with her baton and she falls to the side, revealing Meagan -- now dressed in the deputy's uniform -- laying on the shower floor. The deputy realizes her mistake too late -- Meagan sprays her in the face with mace and she sinks to her knees, screaming and clutching her face.  Meagan leaps to her feet, grabs a towel to hold over her face (as if she had a broken nose) and starts to exit. On her way out, Meagan is passed by several DEPUTIES charging into the showers to restore order.  She gestures them on, then slips into an emergency exit to freedom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meagan exits the station just as a patrol car pulls up.  She reaches in and grabs the JUNIOR TROOPER, pulling him out.  Then she slips behind the wheel and ROARS off.  The junior trooper calls after her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, that's Captain Murdoch's car!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cultists surround Reverend Lovejoy as he nervously shakes his head, saying:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't do it! It's a sin! Blasphemy! One of the cultists puts a gun to Mrs. Lovejoy's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wedding or funeral... your choice. The reverend swallows and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And who would be the bride? Lizzy is brought forth.  The cultists take her arm and inject her with the dream dope.  Lizzy's head lulls around as she chants softly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One... two... Freddy's coming for you. The rest of the cultists shoot up -- passing the needle from one to another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three... four... Better lock your door. The good reverend watches this with a lump in his throat.  He shudders and asks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the groom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's coming... Lizzy is almost asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five... six... grab your crucifix... The neon cross behind the podium begins to flicker. Then with a sharp SNAP of electricity, the cross falls over, turning upside down.  It hangs there for an instant then -- POW! -- the cross EXPLODES, catching the curtains on FIRE. As the FLAMES consume the curtains, a hole in reality appears -- a Dreamgate.  Freddy comes springing out, leaping in front of the podium.  He laughs and turns to Lizzy, asleep on the bench.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's for the lift sister! (to the cultists) Hiya, kids!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hiya, Freddy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready to get hitched?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready, Freddy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then let's do it! Lizzy looks up and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you, Freddy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes up to Murdoch and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We found your patrol car, Captain. It was abandoned near a local religious station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Religious station? Is there a padre there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. Reverend Lovejoy broad- casts out of that location.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So that's where they're hiding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lizzy and Freddy stand before Reverend Lovejoy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and if there be anyone among you who has any reason why these two should not be joined in holy... Freddy holds up a finger -- "Ah-ah".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...in matrimony. Let them speak now... (under his breath) ...please God... (aloud) ...or forever hold their peace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! -- Meagan bursts in.
